articles.title: Rugby-Springboks change 14 for Argentina rematch in Buenos Aires
articles.description: Read more about Rugby-Springboks change 14 for Argentina rematch in Buenos Aires on Devdiscourse
articles.content: Hooker Bongi Mbonambi will lead a new-look South Africa side in their Rugby World Cup warm-up fixture against Argentina in Buenos Aires on Saturday with a potential debut off the bench for prop Gerhard Steenekamp. Springbok coach Jacques Nienaber mad... [2557 chars]

articles.title: Argentina are leaving off-field issues behind - this Women’s World Cup feels like a new start
articles.description: With their captain back and huge support in the stands, Argentina Women's team are on the rise - but still await their first World Cup win
articles.content: Sophia Braun was outside the box when she drilled a loose ball past South Africa’s goalkeeper, bringing every Argentine fan inside New Zealand’s Dunedin Stadium to their feet. The goal, deep into the second half, proved to be a crucial moment for La ... [9889 chars]

articles.title: Lithium Americas shareholders approve split between U.S. and Argentina businesses
articles.description: VANCOUVER — Lithium Americas Corp. says shareholders have approved its split into two companies. The Vancouver-based company says shareholders voted in favour of separating the company into two entities: Lithium Americas (Argentina) Corp.
articles.content:
VANCOUVER — Lithium Americas Corp. says shareholders have approved its split into two companies.

articles.title: Lowcountry man helps Argentinian youth table tennis team after travel mix-up
articles.description: A Charleston table tennis club player went out of his way to help a young team from Argentina keep doing what they love after a planned trip took a wrong turn.
articles.content:
CHARLESTON, S.C. (WCSC) - A Charleston table tennis club player went out of his way to help a young team from Argentina keep doing what they love after a planned trip took a wrong turn.
The last few days have been rocky for the Argentinian youth tabl... [1630 chars]

articles.title: Antarctica loses Argentina-size sea ice. But why is it not returning?
articles.description: This time every year Antarctica's sea ice builds back up. But this year scientists have observed something different.
articles.content:
Antarctica is missing an Argentina-sized amount of sea ice — around 1.6 million square kilometers (0.6 million square miles—reaching unprecedented lows for this time of year, according to a recent CNN article.
Each year, as the Antarctic summer draws... [507 chars]
